result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Norman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before May 30, 2016.  Submit to DNA sample.  Transfer to Marquette County jail approved, per jail rules.
Consecutive to: any other sentences.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James R. Norman in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend 943.50(1n)(b), Class A Mis.   State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Raabe agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Defendant makes final statement to the court.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 fine or costs, $200.00 DNA surcharge and $10.00 property crime surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
10 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Jail to commence on or before May 30, 2016 at 6:30 p.m.  1 day credit.  Transfer to Marquette County jail, per jail rules.  
Submit to DNA sample.  
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant James R. Norman in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe requests prelim/time limits waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference at 01-29-2016 10:45 am.
Return date at 02-09-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant James R. Norman in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE re: counsel.  DE says he was assigned an attorney by the PD's office but he hasn't heard from them who that is yet.  State requests DE go to PD's office today and today's hearing be reset one week.  DE says he went to PTC but said he wanted counsel so no one spoke to him.  Court resets and advises DE to go right to the PD's office after court today to find out about counsel.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 01-08-2016 10:00 am.
Return date at 01-12-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant James R. Norman appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not applied for PD.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State request signature bond with conditions.  Advised rights to an attorney. Time limits waived. $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with Walmart Stores.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
